class Pathname

Detailed Description

Iterates over segments of a pathname.

Class Iterator iterates over the associated pathname sequentially from the first to the last segment. An iterator points to a distinct pathname segment and can be increased and dereferenced, i.e. the pathname segment the iterator points to can be retrieved.

Returns the segment the iterator points to.

BOOLEAN Pathname::Iterator::operator!= (  const Iterator &  itor  )  const
 

Checks if this iterator and itor point to different segments.

Pathname::Iterator Pathname::Iterator::operator++ (  INT   ) 
 

The postfix increment operator. Increments the iterator to point to the next segment and returns an iterator pointing to the segment before having been incremented.

Returns:
Iterator pointing to the segment before having been incremented.

Pathname::Iterator & Pathname::Iterator::operator++ (   ) 
 

The prefix increment operator. Increments the iterator to point to the next segment and returns a reference to itself.

Returns:
Reference to the incremented iterator.

BOOLEAN Pathname::Iterator::operator< (  const Iterator &  itor  )  const
 

Checks if this iterator points to a segment that is before the segment that itor points to.

BOOLEAN Pathname::Iterator::operator== (  const Iterator &  itor  )  const
 

Checks if this iterator and itor point to the same segment.

BOOLEAN Pathname::Iterator::operator> (  const Iterator &  itor  )  const
 

Checks if this iterator points to a segment that is after the segment that itor points to.
